intro: Pyrus greenii, commonly known as the Greenii pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. The plant is characterized by its ornamental value, featuring showy white flowers that appear in early spring. Its leaves are typically dark green and have a rough texture. The fruit, which is edible, is small and yellow when ripe, though it is not widely cultivated for commercial use.
